comments.body: It makes sense to start on a smaller scale, at the city and state level. The federal government giving a head start to city and states to accumulate at lower prices, before announcing a bitcoin reserve at the national level makes sense to me.You can add Kentucky and South Dakota to the list. It looks like the number of states with proposals is up to 15 and counting. Even Massachusetts has a proposal for a bitcoin reserve, Elizabeth Warren's state, one of the biggest bitcoin haters there is.I would like to see the look on her face if and when the proposal passes in her state.
